extra.enrollment_requirement: PREREQUISITE    Level 3 in a HLTH, PHED or KINE Plan and HLTH 101/3.0

basic.description: This course examines global health from a variety of perspectives, including anthropological, epidemiological, and sociological, to help understand the cultural and historical patterns shaping global health inequalities. With an emphasis on resource-poor countries, specific topics may include infectious and non-communicable diseases, nutrition and maternal health.
basic.subject: HLTH
basic.title: Topics in Global Health
